articles.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN, and more from YouTube TV as content talks break down
articles.description:
Other channels that vanished from Google's pay TV platform include the Disney Channel, FX, and Nat Geo.

The post Disney pulls ABC, ESPN, and more from YouTube TV as content talks break down appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Disney removed ABC, ESPN, and other channels from YouTube TV effective immediately.
Channels like Disney Channel, FX, and Nat Geo also disappeared from the platform.
Boston residents may lose access to major sports and entertainment content due to this breakdown.

Incumbent Brian Worrell is being challenged by Helen Cameron in the District 4 race.

summary: Incumbent Brian Worrell faces challenger Helen Cameron in District 4 race.

Voters will influence key issues affecting District 4 residents' daily lives.

articles.title: Look inside the $65 million renovation of Boston’s oldest hotel
articles.description:
The hotel is celebrating its 170th anniversary.

The post Look inside the $65 million renovation of Boston’s oldest hotel appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston's oldest hotel undergoes a $65 million renovation to celebrate its 170th anniversary.
Renovation includes modern amenities while preserving historic architecture for local heritage.
Improved facilities aim to boost tourism and local economy in Boston's hospitality sector.

articles.title: Boston City Council District 1 race: Gabriela Coletta Zapata
articles.description:
"I believe in the power of local government because I’ve seen its impact up close."

summary: Gabriela Coletta Zapata emphasizes local government’s role in community improvement.
Zapata aims to represent District 1, focusing on resident needs and concerns.
Her campaign highlights the importance of accessible local services for Boston families.

articles.title: Boston City Council at-large race: Frank Baker
articles.description:
"With 37 years of experience working in the city, including 12 on the City Council, my experience far outweighs that of anyone running at this time, including the incumbents."

The post Boston City Council at-large race: Frank Baker appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Frank Baker highlights 37 years of city experience, including 12 years on the City Council.
Baker claims his extensive experience surpasses that of current incumbents in the at-large race.
Boston residents may benefit from Baker's long-term knowledge in local governance and policy.

articles.title: Boston City Council at-large race: Julia Mejia
articles.description:
"Having grown-up low-income with an undocumented mother affords me the empathy necessary to move with urgency around the issues our residents face."

The post Boston City Council at-large race: Julia Mejia appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Julia Mejia emphasizes empathy from her low-income upbringing in Boston's City Council race.
Mejia, an advocate for undocumented residents, aims to address urgent local issues.
Her candidacy could influence policies affecting Boston's low-income and immigrant communities.

articles.title: No matter the records, the ‘Holy War’ between Boston College and Notre Dame remains a heated football rivalry
articles.description:
As he reflects 23 years later, former Boston College standout Jeremy Trueblood isn’t entirely sure what compelled him and a teammate to rip up the Notre Dame grass that day. Now, he wonders what they were thinking. Back then, they found it hysterical. After the Eagles defeated the Fighting Irish, 14-7, in yet another captivating […]

The post No matter the records, the ‘Holy War’ between Boston College and Notre Dame remains a heated football rivalry appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston College defeated Notre Dame 14-7, intensifying their historic football rivalry.
Former player Jeremy Trueblood reflects on the rivalry 23 years after the memorable game.
Local fans continue to support the rivalry, impacting community engagement and school spirit.

articles.title: A 3rd teenager is indicted for the killing of UMass student in D.C.
articles.description:
The 18-year-old has been indicted with first-degree murder and 15 other charges for the killing of Eric Tarpinian-Jachym of Granby, Massachusetts.

The post A 3rd teenager is indicted for the killing of UMass student in D.C. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: An 18-year-old was indicted for the murder of UMass student Eric Tarpinian-Jachym.
The indictment includes first-degree murder and 15 additional charges.
This incident raises safety concerns for Boston students studying in D.C.

summary: Patriots host Falcons on Sunday, November 5, 2023.

Local fans anticipate Maye's impact on the Patriots' playoff chances.
